record.title: LEGISLATIVE TRANSPARENCY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT OF 2007--Continued
record.chair: Under the previous order, the question now occurs on the motion offered by the majority leader to concur in the House amendment to S. 1.

speaking.paragraph: I ask for the yeas and nays.

record.narrative: The clerk will call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: I announce that the Senator from South Dakota (Mr. Johnson) and the Senator from Minnesota (Ms. Klobuchar) are necessarily absent.
I further announce that, if present and voting, the Senator from Minnesota (Ms. Klobuchar), would vote "aye."
The following Senator is necessarily absent: the Senator from Minnesota (Mr. Coleman).
Further, if present and voting, the Senator from Minnesota (Mr. Coleman) would have voted "yea."

record.chair: Are there any other Senators in the Chamber desiring to vote?
record.narrative: The result was announced--yeas 83, nays 14, as follows:

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I move to reconsider the vote by which the motion was agreed to.
I move to lay that motion on the table.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
